page.title: 20MOORBARNS FARM
page.content: Moorbarns Farm is owned by Mr. Boyes. It is a{Mixed Farm}of 370 acres. There are fields of{rape,barley {and grazing.}The seeds are bought each year.Mr. Boyes has 25 friesian bullocks, 155 lambs, 160 ewes and one Hereford bull. The cows produce 290 gallons of milk a day when they are milked by machinery in the milking parlour. Bullocks, sheep and lambs are taken to be killed at a butcher's or slaughter house every year. As well as the haybarns, animal sheds and farmhouse, there are machinery sheds containing Â£70,000 worth of farm machinery such as tractors and a combine. Farming is a round-the-year job and when our class visited the farm we saw sheep being sheared. It was a good job it was warm or the sheep would get very cold.
